revised_title: Correlating Germicidal Action with Selective Absorption in Ultra-Violet Radiation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the portion of the ultra-violet spectrum responsible for germicidal action. They found that the most effective germicidal action occurs in the range of 2960 to 2380 Angstrom units. The study also showed a strong correlation between the region of germicidal action and the absorption spectrum of the bacteria. This research has implications for understanding the effectiveness of ultra-violet radiation in killing bacteria and preventing infections.
